reviews.text: This impressive college campus museum is a great hidden gem.  The "new" wing is underground, so it's largely goes unnoticed, but it's always worth a visit, the exhibits rotate often enough that there's always something interesting to see.
Excellent free museum, recently modernized filling a philanthropic influx. Cleverly curated and arranged pieces. Quiet and peaceful. Really impressive part of campus.
Beautiful Campus and lovely staff with a fantastic art museum.
Some very cool stuff here, the biggest downside is it's small and kind of stuffy.
The Assyrian reliefs are amazing and very well displayed.
The Christmas Eve service is very good.  Welcoming to everyone.
A welcoming parish. Traditional congregationalist service with songs from hymnal, and often an eloquent thoughtul sermon. Talented choir and world class organist.
Beautiful community center

Great part of history if you're ever interested in knowing who visited the artic first. The pioneers who dreaded going for long months to make the journey to the farthest north part of the globe resides in this museum. Some parts of the museum are still being either refurbished or added on, but the majority of the exhibit is completed. Learn a part of history that so many don't realize could help save the global warming epidemic going on right now. Took this photo of a snowman outside of the museum.

Listen to and learn about Music in the Inuit World! 
See amazing art.

Best news, they aren't moving. Current exhibit includes clothing based on old traditions but done in a more modern theme. Be sure to visit this free museum dedicated to the quest of the North and South Poles.
Small, but full and well curated museum about Artic exploration with a comprehensive scavenger hunt for children that doesn't interfere with the adult experience.
This is a very neat little museum that is well worth a visit. And it's free !

Enjoyable

We really liked the setup and the guide was knowledgeable.
Duplex homes of we'll off brothers with furnishings frozen in time.

Our entire experience from start to finish was great.  The staff is always accommodating, friendly, and professional.  We were instantly happy with the responsiveness and ability to put together a terrific menu for us, but when we went for the tasting we were hooked.  The food was fantastic, they were so nice, cooked up everything for us to try, and it only got better when they were cooking for 100 people instead of just two.  111 Maine was also able to handle the baking and the bar service, cutting down on additional vendors and making things simpler for us.  Everything was perfect, Thank you!

Everything about our experience with Jennifer and her expert team at 111 Maine was outstanding.  From the beginning, the menu planning process was thoughtful and Jennifer was very accommodating of our requests as well as offering great suggestions.  Every dish was delicious and memorable.  The goat cheese ravioli with Makers Mark cream made a huge impression on our guests.  We were particularly impressed that the food was served piping hot despite being prepared outdoors in October.  We would recommend 111 Maine without reservation.
Unparalleled service and incredible food.
One of the best caterers in the state. Amazing food, wonderful friendly service, Jennifer and her staff are the best of the best.

It's  close, it's good, it's reasonably priced, what's not to like when you don't  want to cook!  There's  a 5 star Thai restaurant around the corner, but it's  very pricey. Save some money, and if casual dining is your "thing" . . . .

There's usually  no wait here, and the one server will show you to a table rather quickly.  This restaurant  does a good "carry out" business with the college kids up the street. 

This is Asian "comfort food". They cook the basics reasonably well. I've had better, but it's satisfying the urge for the night. The egg rolls & spring rolls are fine. I've tried several of my favorites (Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Chicken, etc.) and they were OK. 

*Side note: Could update their menu, and couple of their booths, have rip in seat.

I'd give this a 3.5 star restaurant  rating.
Convenient friendly and priced well. The service is great
Have been coming here for 5 years. I almost don't want to share because this place is our go to. Never a wait or unclean. I love that the food is great and always fresh! We come here EVERY week. ♡
Very very good.

Good food, fresh. The triple garlic was spicy and the shrimp was cooked just right.  My wife enjoyed the sea food delight (no lobster in dish presently as prices are high, but that was OK). We definitely will eat here again.

The weekend lunch buffet special for $13 is a total steal! Good selection of both meat and vegetarian options. Everything was hot fresh and delicious. The atmosphere was very cool and the service was friendly. Can't wait to go back.

My fiancé and I decided to treat ourselves to a date night over the summer, and spotted two open outdoor tables. We walked inside where we were spoken to by three different staff in passing that they were busy and it would be an hour wait. We told them about the tables outside, confused because we were the only waiting customers. They didn’t respond. Then the embarrassment happened..as we turned to leave, a server darted between us and stepped on my shoe. I stepped on my fiance’s foot, and he came close to falling out the door. We laughed it off later. I understand it’s crowded and tiny, but better communication would have prevented this. I’m sure they have some good dishes. In retrospect-I’m glad we went to a place, based on the menus, that makes more variations of things I can eat with my food allergies- but that’s my personal diet. I understand the waitstaff was overwhelmed as well. So were we.
Great food and great service. One of my favorite Indian restaurants in Maine.
Good buffet. Small in size but tasty. Great service.
Incredible food and amazing service!

Good food for the price.  Seniors like the menu and value. Family restaurant with great seafood chowders. Their fish is well cooked and if you like meatloaf you'll be happy. Desserts are home made and yummy. Handicapped accessible.

The wait staff was cheerful and helpful.  We arrived shortly before closing time and stayed a little past.  The food was very good, especially the sweet potato fries.  I would recommend them without hesitation.

Second Best Boss I've ever had. First was my grandmother. All in all excellent food and service with a timely fashion. Great place for reservations and parties! Always Fresh Seafood,Steaks,Burgers,Chicken,Chowders and even Pasta. Weekly Specials and a large variety of desserts! Beers,Wines and even the Captain Him self! Great place for Fresh Maine Boiled lobster/Baked Stuffed lobster and other great dishes! Stop in and see for your self!

Service took forever - we got there before numerous other customers who received their appetizers before us. Waitress didn't come in to check on us or explain the wait time. Also worth noting our party wasn't particularly large, consisting of 4 people. My sister had a fly in her soda. When the food finally arrived, it was mediocre at best. Would highly not recommend.

GREAT Service but the whole lobsters were gone by the time we got there. Not all was lost as I got at least the 'Lazy Lobster' dish which was very good. I loved the homemade root beer too. Very rich and tasty.

El Camino is consistently excellent! It's a very small place with a neat vibe that's off the beaten path in Brunswick. I have been there several times and always end up ordering from their ever-changing and extensive specials menu. Some of their dishes are more of a twist on Mexican than they are traditional, but don't let that deter you...the food is always amazing. If you like fish, definitely try the salt cod fritters! Their guac is very good as well. During my last visit, I had the most delicious red snapper over rice, veggies, and fried capers - I would go back every day for that meal! I typically get enchiladas, which are always excellent as well.

Great little restaurant and they offer a lot of gluten free options which makes it great for those who have food allergies. Delicious  drinks and cool mixes. Wonderful service and friendly staff will definitely go back again soon.

The dark sauce on the roasted chicken enchilada was strange...overpowering alcohol or vinegar taste. Food overall just ok, actually rather bland. Atmosphere was funky and fun. Joint was really busy so others must like it. Our party of 4 agreed that we probably won't return.
Great Mexican. Nice flavors. Loved it. This is not Tex-Mex. Reminded me of Mexican food that I've eaten in California. I had the squash lasagna, was very good!!

The drinks were awful, the salsa is just tomato paste with cilantro, and one server, an older blonde woman, was extremely rude. We showed her that our hot sauce had been left open and turned to crust, just asking for a new one. She walked off in the middle of our sentence and loudly complained about us asking to her coworker. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. Also, no straws.

Large, beautiful building centrally located in the heart of Main St., Brunswick. I met my dad here for dinner and we enjoyed our dining experience. There is plenty of parking right on Main St, but you might find it easier to park in the public lot directly in-back in the restaurant. Spacious inside the restaurant and food was prepared fast. I thought it was a little dark, and there was only one server, but she did a fantastic job by herself! Daily specials and good variety of German beers and food.

The service, food and atmosphere were excellent.  Upon stepping through the door, I was shown to a table.  The waitress was friendly and knowledgeable.  The food, which in my case was a special for dinner and a piece of cake for dessert, was promptly served, delicious, and priced fairly. The dim lighting in the resturant matched the dark wooden interior and, combined with the old time german music, created a warm and comfortable ambiance.  I would happily go back.

Nice atmosphere, great staff. I have been here a few times, and it’s always enjoyable, staff/service are terrific. But the food is just not remarkable. It’s fine - but not more than that in my experience. If you are looking for knock your socks off German food, make an outing to Morse’s. Or try Schulte & Herr in Portland (but BYOB!).
Place is very nice. Lots of atmosphere. Food is worth it. Wait staff excellent

Over the last several years this has become one of my favorite places to dine. Amazing food (it’s always a struggle to choose a meal because they’re all so delicious), funny, friendly staff and s nice German beer selection.

My favorite place to go! The staff is always great and willing to let you try whatever you want and be very helpful and friendly. They know what flavors are gluten free. If you ask what's in it they'll be able to describe every candy piece or fruit flavor in great detail. They always have creative and unique flavors that leave me coming back for more! However they don't change all of their flavors so if you have a few that are dear to your heart you can always chow down!

I LOVE this place. It is my family's treat spot of choice!  Our go-to place after a good report card. The flavors are simply amazing. Always capturing the fundamental essence of what they're going for. Turkish Coffee was my personal fave.the employees are always eager to help and super-pleasant, even when busy. Cheek out the "red spoon club"... makes it even sweeter! Oh!  Don't forget the coffee! I love the coffee. Can't wait to come back!
Love this place. Been to Italy 4 times and this place has more flavors than anywhere I've been. Great service and atmosphere. Also, great taste

I’m in Maine on business and decided to stop in on a whim for a snack. The flavors were authentic Italian and their customer service was superior to any I’ve experience in the past. The young woman who served me (Courtney) was pleasant, attentive, knowledgeable and incredibly kind. So often when you go to a place like this you expect to be treated like just another customer, but she made me feel truly welcome and genuinely interested in making sure I’d have a good experience. If my travels ever bring me back to Maine, I’ll definitely make another stop in to Gelato Fiasco!
Gelato was great, a little sweet, but great. Peter was less than sweet. The other staff was very nice.

Got to LOVE their sandwiches! The bread is made daily rite there. They offer a wide variety of choices, anything from burritos to Thai noodles! I love the various options of toppings especially the shredded carrots, cucumbers and RED onions! No other local eatery offers as many different soups as Wild Oats. Also they have some of the best desserts to choose from-a sweet way to end your yummy eating experience!

I usually love Wild Oats food and desserts. However I was extremely disappointed today to stop by and get a cupcake to bring home for Valentines Day only to get home and find it frozen inside. While I understand they can’t make everything from scratch, a little more attention to detail to allow them to thaw first, before selling would be great.

This is one of my favorite stops for lunch if I am in the Brunswick area. The sandwiches, burritos, soups, salads and their desserts are amazing! I always cant help my self in grabbing a blueberry chees cake and a mocha whoopie pie for my partner. Everything is fresh and they make coffee there too. Great place.

Very beautiful interior but limited parking. The staff was efficient but the prices were quite high. They have quite a large selection of items not many of which are vegan. If you're on a budget this place can't be an everyday stop more of a treat.

Fabulous local bakery with delicious food! Their soups are amazing with at least 10 to 12 different selections to choose from daily. The deli counter offers great sandwiches and salads. And don't get me started on their baked goods!! Parking on site is limited and difficult. Look for a place on Maine Street or near the town park. It's a short walk and worth avoiding the congestion of trying to access their tiny lot.
